Heap vs Stack What is “The Heap”? The Heap is commonly used for allocating memory for objects, arrays, and other data structures that require a flexible size during program execution. It is particularly useful in scenarios where the size of the data is not known beforehand or may change during the program’s runtime. Examples include dynamically sized arrays, linked lists, and instances of classes in object-oriented programming.
Heap memory refers to a region of a computer’s memory used for dynamic memory allocation.
title: Heap vs Stack
